ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would not recommend this course

This course explains the principles of population genetics and ancestry, as well as risk prediction (with respect to disease) and modeling genetic effects on multiple levels (e.g., SNPs, genes, gene networks, etc.) It requires a background in both statistics and medical genetics (i.e., familiarity with using genetics to predict phenotypes and/or disease, but not necessarily cell biology). I would recommend it to students interested in employing statistical genetic methods in their own work, but probably not to students with general interest in this field.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Not too much as I see so far...
It helped me build vocabularies in the genetics field

I thought it added considerably to my knowledge of both statistical genetic methods and the theory behind them. The course should be very useful towards my research, which is focused on genetic risk prediction in schizophrenia.
